alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 04 at 4:17PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Comanche, southwestern Grady and southeastern Caddo Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Apache, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Elgin, Apache, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Verden, Cement, Medicine Park, Norge, Lake Lawtonka, Agawam, Boone, Lake Ellsworth, Fort Sill, Ninnekah, Acme, Stecker and Laverty. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 45 and 77. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
